These five perches, therefore, seem te be the several entrances by which the unclean went down into the waters to be washed3 and in which, before washing, they might lay up theiri clothes, and after it put them en again, being there always protected from the rain. And perhaps they had their different entrances and descents according to the different sert-s ef uncleanness, that all those that were ene and the same way defiled should have one and the same entrance and descent into the pool.
